H0.text: Weight and time are needed to determine the amount of gravitational force between two objects.

H1.text: Distance and mass are needed to determine the amount of gravitational force between two objects.

H2.text: Volume and mass are needed to determine the amount of gravitational force between two objects.

H3.text: Area and weight are needed to determine the amount of gravitational force between two objects.

A4.text: The gravitational force acting between two objects is proportional to the product of their masses and inversely proportional to the square of the distance between their centers of mass.

A5.text: Newton's law of universal gravitation describes gravity as a force that depends on the masses of the objects and the distance between them.
